input_text:
Job Title: Epic Healthy Planet Analyst (Remote)

Location: Washington, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Other

Description:
This is Permanent (Full Time) role with Valley Medical Center
Job DescriptionThe position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands, and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization. Clinical Application Analyst (Epic) I, II, Sr JOB OVERVIEW: The Clinical Application Analyst (Epic) I role will troubleshoot, document, and resolve IT application issues in a timely manner with guidance. The Clinical Application Analyst (Epic) II will demonstrate competence in analysis and troubleshooting, healthcare computing environments and be a self-directed learner with excellent communication skills. The Clinical Application Analyst (Epic) Analyst Sr will demonstrate mastery in analysis and troubleshooting, healthcare computing environments and be a self-directed learner with excellent communication skills.
Level I:Bachelor's degree plus one (1) year industry related experience, OR Associates degree and two (2) years related experience, OR three (3) years related experience.Applied Job Experience: Information Services Background: Industry experience preferred as an information technology analyst or Clinical Background: Clinical experience in an acute or ambulatory care setting. Clinical or Health & Life Science education/degree/licensure (RN, RRT, RPH) is a plus or Healthcare Operations Background: Experience in healthcare operations, such as billing, scheduling, access services, health information management or other support functions. Knowledge of computerized appointment scheduling, billing procedures, coding and patient flow is a plus.Certifications: Any certifications related to software applications, technology infrastructure and/or clinical specializations is an advantage. Previous Epic certification preferred.Must be able to obtain applicable Epic certification and complete all required application course work within six months of hire date. Level IIBachelor's degree plus 2-3 years industry related experience, OR Associates degree and four (4) years related experience, OR five (5) years related experience.Applied Job Experience: Information Services Background: Industry experience preferred as an information technology analyst. Some Small Project lead experience required, or Clinical Background: Clinical experience in an acute or ambulatory care setting. Clinical or Health & Life Science education/degree/licensure (RN, RRT, RPH) is a plus. Lead experience preferred, or Healthcare Operations Background: Experience in healthcare operations, such as billing, scheduling, access services, health information management or other support functions. Knowledge of computerized appointment scheduling, billing procedures, coding and patient flow is a plus.Certifications: Any certifications related to software applications, technology infrastructure and/or clinical specializations is an advantage. Current Epic proficiencies or certification required. Level SrBachelor's degree plus 5 (five) years industry related experience, OR Associates degree and eight (8) years related experience, OR ten (10) years related experience.Applied Job Experience: Information Services Background: Industry experience preferred as an information technology analyst. Mastery of Complex/Multiple Resources Small Project lead experience required or Clinical Background: Clinical experience in an acute or ambulatory care setting. Clinical or Health & Life Science education/degree/licensure (RN, RRT, RPH) is a plus. Lead experience required. Or Healthcare Operations Background: Experience in healthcare operations, such as billing, scheduling, access services, health information management or other support functions. Knowledge of computerized appointment scheduling, billing procedures, coding and patient flow is a plus. Lead experience required.Certifications: Any certifications related to software applications, technology infrastructure and/or clinical specializations is an advantage. Current Epic certification(s) are required.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

Level II:Bachelor's degree plus 2-3 years industry related experience, OR Associates degree and four (4) years related experience, OR five (5) years related experience.
Level Sr:Bachelor's degree plus 5 (five) years industry related experience, OR Associates degree and eight (8) years related experience, OR ten (10) years related experience.
